Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Fifty-two percent of 170 respondents said they need more information about what will happen to asylum.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Project 2025 is a plan created by a conservative think tank with ties to Trump that lays out what the president should change in the first 180 days after taking office.
Document Sources.Source Justification: a plan created by a conservative think tank with ties to Trump

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Brian Manning, a political asylum lawyer and former government asylum officer, said that asylum could be impacted by a second Trump presidency more drastically than before.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: political asylum lawyer and former government asylum officer
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: political asylum lawyer and former government asylum officer

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "It is safe to assume that after the many missteps of his first presidency, that his administration would be better equipped to learn from their past mistakes and more effectively attack immigrant communities from the White House," Marlene Galaz, Director of Immigrant Rights Policy, New York Immigration Coalition, said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Director of Immigrant Rights Policy, New York Immigration Coalition

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "We anticipate the president, Trump, to use its executive authority to implement these policies — but again, we anticipate we should be able to challenge," Nils Kinuani, Federal Policy Manager at African Communities Together (ACT), said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Federal Policy Manager at African Communities Together (ACT)
